strong.description: All characters that constitute strong boundaries, for one language.
strong.title: Strong

weak.description: All characters that constitute strong boundaries, for one language.
weak.title: Weak

exclamations.description: Exclamation punctuation symbols used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <EXCL> internally.
exclamations.title: Exclamations

question_symbols.description: Question/interrogative punctuation symbols used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <QINT> internally.
question_symbols.title: Question Symbols

quotemarks.description: Quotemark punctuation symbols used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <QUOTE> internally.
quotemarks.title: Quotemarks

parentheses.description: Punctuation symbols indicating parentheses, brackets, or braces. Replaces these symbols with <PAREN> internally.
parentheses.title: Parentheses

periods.description: Punctuation symbols indicating a 'period' used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <PERIOD> internally.
periods.title: Periods

colons.description: Punctuation symbols indicating a 'colon' used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <COLON> internally.
colons.title: Colons

semi_colons.description: Punctuation symbols indicating a 'semi-colon' used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <SEMICOL> internally.
semi_colons.title: Semi Colons

hyphens.description: Punctuation symbols indicating a 'hyphen' used in your datasets. * is a hyphen by default since unidecode decodes middle-dot punctuation as an asterisk. Replaces these symbols with <HYPHEN> internally.
hyphens.title: Hyphens

commas.description: Punctuation symbols indicating a 'comma' used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <COMMA> internally.
commas.title: Commas

ellipses.description: Punctuation symbols indicating ellipses used in your datasets. Replaces these symbols with <EPS> internally.
ellipses.title: Ellipses

silence.description: The symbol(s) used to indicate silence.
silence.title: Silence

punctuation.description: EveryVoice will combine punctuation and normalize it into a set of five permissible types of punctuation to help tractable training.

to_replace.description: Map of match-to-replacement to apply on training and run-time text, before cleaners are applied. Superceded by language_to_replace when processing text in a language which has language-specific text replacements, which are in turn superceded by dataset_to_replace when processing a dataset which has dataset-specific text replacements.
to_replace.title: Global text replacements

language_to_replace.description: Map from language code to text replacement maps. Supercedes the global text replacements when defined for a given language. Superceded by dataset_to_replace when processing a dataset which has dataset-specific text replacements.
language_to_replace.title: Language-specific text replacements

dataset_to_replace.description: Map from dataset label to replacement maps. Supercedes both the global text replacements and language_to_replace when defined for a given dataset.
dataset_to_replace.title: Dataset-specific text replacements.

cleaners.description: List of cleaners to apply to all datasets and run-time data. Superceded by language_cleaners when processing text in a language which has language-specific cleaners, which are in turn superceded by dataset_cleaners when processing a dataset which has dataset-specific cleaners.
cleaners.title: Global cleaners

language_cleaners.description: Map from language code to cleaner lists. Supercedes the global cleaners when defined for a given language. Superceded by dataset_cleaners when processing a dataset which has dataset-specific cleaners.
language_cleaners.title: Language-specific cleaners

dataset_cleaners.description: Map from dataset label to cleaner lists. Supercedes both the global cleaners and language_cleaners when defined for a given dataset.
dataset_cleaners.title: Dataset-specific cleaners

g2p_engines.description:
User defined or external G2P engines.
See https://github.com/EveryVoiceTTS/everyvoice_g2p_template_plugin to implement your own G2P.
g2p_engines.title: External G2P

split_text.description: Whether or not to perform text splitting (also referred to as text chunking) at inference time. Instead of synthesizing an entire utterance, the utterance will be split into smaller chunks and re-combined after synthesis. This can lead to more natural synthesis for long-form (i.e. paragraph) synthesis.
split_text.title: Split Text

boundaries.description: Strong and Weak boundaries on which text splitting is to be performed, for every language.
boundaries.title: Boundaries
